item.text: You are children of the Lord your God. Do not cut yourselves or shave your forehead bald for the sake of the dead.
For you are a people holy to the Lord your God. He has chosen you to be his people, prized above all others on the face of the earth.
You must not eat any forbidden thing.

<st data-num="02063" class="">These</st> are the <st data-num="0929" class="">animals</st> you may <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st>: the <st data-num="07794" class="">ox</st>, the <st data-num="07716 03775">sheep</st>, the <st data-num="07716 05795">goat</st>,

the <st data-num="0354" class="">ibex</st>,<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="06643" class="">gazelle</st>,<n id="2" /> the <st data-num="03180" class="">deer</st>,<n id="3" /> the <st data-num="0689" class="">wild goat</st>, the <st data-num="01788" class="">antelope</st>,<n id="4" /> the <st data-num="08377" class="">wild oryx</st>,<n id="5" /> and the <st data-num="02169" class="">mountain sheep</st>.<n id="6" />

You may <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">any</st> <st data-num="0929" class="">animal</st> that <st data-num="06536" class="">has</st> <st data-num="06541" class="">hooves</st> <st data-num="08156" class="">divided</st> <st data-num="08157" class="">into</st> <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="06541" class="">parts</st> and that <st data-num="05927" class="">chews</st> the <st data-num="01625" class="">cud</st>.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="0389" class="">However</st>, you may <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">the following</st> animals among those that <st data-num="05927" class="">chew</st> the <st data-num="01625" class="">cud</st> or those that <st data-num="06536" class="">have</st> <st data-num="08156" class="">divided</st> <st data-num="06541" class="">hooves</st>: the <st data-num="01581" class="">camel</st>, the <st data-num="0768" class="">hare</st>, and the <st data-num="08227" class="">rock badger</st>.<n id="1" /> (<st data-num="03588">Although</st> <st data-num="01992" class="">they</st> <st data-num="05927" class="">chew</st> the <st data-num="01625" class="">cud</st>, <st data-num="01992" class="">they</st> do <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> have <st data-num="06536" class="">divided</st> <st data-num="06541" class="">hooves</st> and are therefore <st data-num="02931" class="">ritually impure</st> to you.)
Also, the pig is ritually impure to you; though it has divided hooves, it does not chew the cud. You may not eat their meat or even touch their remains.
These you may eat from among water creatures: anything with fins and scales you may eat,
but whatever does not have fins and scales you may not eat; it is ritually impure to you.
All ritually clean birds you may eat.

<st data-num="02088" class="">These</st> are <st data-num="0834 01992">the ones</st> you may <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st>: the <st data-num="05404" class="">eagle</st>,<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="06538" class="">vulture</st>,<n id="2" /> the <st data-num="05822" class="">black vulture</st>,<n id="3" />

the <st data-num="07201" class="">kite</st>, the <st data-num="0344" class="">black kite</st>, the <st data-num="01772" class="">dayyah</st><n id="1" /> after its <st data-num="04327" class="">species</st>,
<st data-num="03605" class="">every</st> <st data-num="06158" class="">raven</st> after its <st data-num="04327" class="">species</st>,

the <st data-num="01323 03284">ostrich</st>,<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="08464" class="">owl</st>,<n id="2" /> the <st data-num="07828" class="">seagull</st>, the <st data-num="05322" class="">falcon</st><n id="3" /> after its <st data-num="04327" class="">species</st>,
the <st data-num="03563" class="">little owl</st>, the <st data-num="03244" class="">long-eared owl</st>, the <st data-num="08580" class="">white owl</st>,<n id="1" />
the <st data-num="06893" class="">jackdaw</st>,<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="07360" class="">carrion vulture</st>, the <st data-num="07994" class="">cormorant</st>,
the stork, the heron after its species, the hoopoe, and the bat.
And any swarming winged thing is impure to you—they may not be eaten.
You may <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">any</st> <st data-num="05775" class="">winged creature</st> that is <st data-num="02889" class="">clean</st>.

You may not eat any corpse, though you may give it to the resident foreigner who is living in your villages and he may eat it, or you may sell it to a foreigner. You are a people holy to the Lord your God. Do not boil a young goat in its mother’s milk.
You must be certain to tithe all the produce of your seed that comes from the field year after year.

In the presence of the Lord your God, in the place he chooses to locate his name, you must eat from the tithe of your grain, your new wine, your olive oil, and the firstborn of your herds and flocks, so that you may learn to revere the Lord your God always.

<st data-num="03588" class="">When</st> <st data-num="03068 0430">he</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="01288" class="">blesses</st> you, <st data-num="03588" class="">if</st> the<n id="2" /> <st data-num="04725" class="">place</st> <st data-num="0834 08033">where</st> <st data-num="03068 0430">he</st> <st data-num="0977" class="">chooses</st> to <st data-num="07760" class="">locate</st> his <st data-num="08034" class="">name</st> <st data-num="07368" class="">is distant</st>,
you may convert the tithe into money, secure the money, and travel to the place the Lord your God chooses for himself.
Then you may spend the money however you wish for cattle, sheep, wine, beer, or whatever you desire. You and your household may eat there in the presence of the Lord your God and enjoy it.

As for the <st data-num="03881" class="">Levites</st> in your <st data-num="08179" class="">villages</st>, you must <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05800" class="">ignore</st> them, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> they <st data-num="0369" class="">have no</st> <st data-num="02506" class="">allotment</st> or <st data-num="05159" class="">inheritance</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">along with</st> you.

At the <st data-num="07097" class="">end</st> of every <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> you must <st data-num="03318" class="">bring</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="04643" class="">tithe</st> of your <st data-num="08393" class="">produce</st>, in <st data-num="01931" class="">that</st> very <st data-num="08141" class="">year</st>, and you must <st data-num="03240" class="">store</st> it <st data-num="03240" class="">up</st> in your <st data-num="08179" class="">villages</st>.

Then the Levites (because they have no allotment or inheritance with you), the resident foreigners, the orphans, and the widows of your villages may come and eat their fill so that the Lord your God may bless you in all the work you do.
